description:
Rhinolophus sinicus, also known as the Chinese horseshoe bat, is a species of bat belonging to the family Rhinolophidae. It is found in China, Taiwan, and Vietnam.

The Chinese horseshoe bat is a medium-sized bat, with a body length ranging from 5.2 to 6.3 cm and a wingspan of around 30 cm. It has distinctive horseshoe-shaped nose leaves, which are used for echolocation and thermal regulation. The fur is generally reddish-brown to greyish-brown in color.

This species is known to roost in caves, abandoned buildings, and other sheltered areas. It is an insectivorous bat, feeding primarily on moths, beetles, and other flying insects. The Chinese horseshoe bat plays an important role in the ecosystem by contributing to the control of insect populations.

Rhinolophus sinicus is classified as a Least Concern species by the IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. However, it faces threats from habitat loss and degradation due to human activities, such as urbanization and cave disturbance.
